result.execSummary:
The defendant Harold N Gilmore Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Counseling/assessments deemed appropriate
Comply with Sex Offender Registration

No contact directly or indirectly with the victim
Have no unsupervised contact with female juveniles, incidental contact at school allowed, Defendant is allowed contact with siblings and relatives

timeConds.notes:
With school/work release
This sentence is to be served consecutive to any other sentence now being served unless otherwise ordered by the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment.

Have no unsupervised contact with juveniles under the age of 18, exception - can be around brothers and sisters.
No contact directly or indirectly with the victim.

Counseling/assessments deemed appropriate by agent.
Continue Sex Offender Registry.
